metadata.title: CVE-2012-2666 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
golang/go in 1.0.2 fixes all.bash on shared machines. dotest() in src/pkg/debug/gosym/pclntab_test.go creates a temporary file with predicable name and executes it as shell script.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2012-2666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.13 - 1.0.2
golang-1.13-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.13-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.15 - 1.0.2
golang-1.15-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.15-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.16 - 1.0.2
golang-1.16-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.16-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays. sbeattie> fixed in 1.0.2

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
golang-1.15 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
golang-1.16 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
